Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
The Inventory class is used to create an instance of a container that holds parts and products. It includes various methods which are used to interact with the inventory.

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart​(int index, Part selectedPart)
      RUNTIME ERROR Parts may be updated from InHouse to Outsourced, or from Outsourced to InHouse. Because of this, new objects must be created. Accomplishing this was tricky because the products containing the old part needed to have the respective part removed, and they also needed the new product to be added. I was able to correct this issue by using nested for loops. These for loops iterate through each part on each product and makes appropriate changes.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the old part
      selectedPart - the new part

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct​(int index, Product newProduct)
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the old product
      newProduct - the new product

    • deletePart

      public static void deletePart​(Part selectedPart)
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the part to be deleted

    • deleteProduct

      public static void deleteProduct​(Product selectedProduct)
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the product to be deleted

    • getAllParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
      Returns:
      a list of all parts in the inventory

    • getAllProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getAllProducts()
      Returns:
      a list of all products in the inventory
